Sequence Information.Peptide Name: GRR (Gly-rich region, Synthetic AMPs, N-terminal fragment of SpCrus2, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: Sequence truncation, Crustaceans, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (43.54%) toSpCrus2G: 41%.Activity: Active against Gram+ B. subtilis (MIC 5.6-11.2 uM), B. megaterium (MIC 5.6-11.2 uM), Gram- V.  alginolyticus (MIC 2.8-5.6 uM), V. parahemolyticus (MIC 2.8-5.6 uM), V. harveyi (MIC 2.8-5.6 uM), E. coli (MIC 5.6-11.2 uM).Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: expressed and prufied.
Literature Information.Author: Wang H, Zhang JX, Wang Y, Fang WH, Wang Y, Zhou JF, Zhao S, Li XC. 2018
Literature Information.Title: Newly identified type II crustin (SpCrus2) in Scylla paramamosain contains a distinct cysteine distribution pattern exhibiting broad antimicrobial activity.
